code.name: code
code.value:
from lfx.base.composio.composio_base import ComposioBaseComponent


class ComposioGoogleCalendarAPIComponent(ComposioBaseComponent):
    display_name: str = "GoogleCalendar"
    icon = "Googlecalendar"
    documentation: str = "https://docs.composio.dev"
    app_name = "googlecalendar"

    def set_default_tools(self):
        """Set the default tools for Google Calendar component."""

generic_api_key.info: Enter API key on Composio page
generic_api_key.name: generic_api_key

tools_metadata.info: Modify tool names and descriptions to help agents understand when to use each tool.
tools_metadata.name: tools_metadata

calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

role.description: The role assigned to the scope. Possible values are: "none" - Provides no access; "freeBusyReader" - Provides read access to free/busy information; "reader" - Provides read access to the calendar (private events appear but details are hidden); "writer" - Provides read and write access to the calendar (private events and details are visible); "owner" - Provides ownership of the calendar (all permissions of writer plus ability to see and manipulate ACLs). Please provide a value of type string.
role.title: Role

rule_id.description: ACL rule identifier. This is typically in the format 'type:value', such as 'user:email@example.com' or 'group:group@example.com'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
rule_id.title: Rule Id

scope.description: The extent to which calendar access is granted by this ACL rule. Optional for patch operations.

send_notifications.description: Whether to send notifications about the calendar sharing change. Note that there are no notifications on access removal. Optional. The default is True. Please provide a value of type boolean.
send_notifications.title: Send Notifications

value.description: Updates an access control rule for a calendar using patch semantics (partial update). This allows modifying specific fields without affecting other properties. Note: Each patch request consumes three quota units. For domain-type ACL rules, if PATCH fails with 500 error, this action will automatically fallback to UPDATE method.
value.display_description: Updates an access control rule for a calendar using patch semantics (partial update). This allows modifying specific fields without affecting other properties. Note: Each patch request consumes three quota units. For domain-type ACL rules, if PATCH fails with 500 error, this action will automatically fallback to UPDATE method.
value.name: googlecalendar_acl_patch

background_color.description: The background color of the calendar in the Web UI. (Hexadecimal color code). Please provide a value of type string.
background_color.title: Background Color

color_id.description: The color of the calendar. This is an ID referring to an entry in the calendarCore color palette. Please provide a value of type string.
color_id.title: Color Id

color_rgb_format.description: Whether to use the foregroundColor and backgroundColor fields to write the calendar colors (RGB). If this feature is used, the index-based colorId field will be set to the best matching option automatically. Optional. The default is False. Please provide a value of type boolean.
color_rgb_format.title: Color Rgb Format

default_reminders.description: The default reminders that the authenticated user has for this calendar.
default_reminders.title: Default Reminders

foreground_color.description: The foreground color of the calendar in the Web UI. (Hexadecimal color code). Please provide a value of type string.
foreground_color.title: Foreground Color

hidden.description: Whether the calendar has been hidden from the list. Default is False. Please provide a value of type boolean.
hidden.title: Hidden

id.description: The identifier of the calendar to insert. Must be a valid calendar ID in email format (e.g., 'user@example.com' for a user's calendar or 'calendarid@group.calendar.google.com' for a shared calendar). Note: The 'primary' keyword is not supported for this operation - use the actual email address of the primary calendar instead. The calendar must exist and you must have appropriate access permissions. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
id.title: Id

notification_settings.description: The notifications that the authenticated user is receiving for this calendar.

selected.description: Whether the calendar is selected and visible in the calendar list. Default is True. Please provide a value of type boolean.
selected.title: Selected

summary_override.description: The summary that the authenticated user has set for this calendar. Please provide a value of type string.
summary_override.title: Summary Override

value.description: Inserts an existing calendar into the user's calendar list.
value.display_description: Inserts an existing calendar into the user's calendar list.
value.name: googlecalendar_calendar_list_insert

backgroundColor.description: Hex color for calendar background. Please provide a value of type string.
backgroundColor.title: Backgroundcolor

calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier. Must be an actual calendar ID (e.g., "examplecalendar@group.calendar.google.com" or "c_abc123...@group.calendar.google.com"). To retrieve valid calendar IDs, use the GOOGLECALENDAR_LIST_CALENDARS action first. The "primary" alias is not valid for calendarList.update. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

colorId.description: ID for calendar color from colors endpoint. Please provide a value of type string.
colorId.title: Colorid

colorRgbFormat.description: Whether to use RGB for foreground/background colors. Please provide a value of type boolean.
colorRgbFormat.title: Colorrgbformat

foregroundColor.description: Hex color for calendar foreground. Please provide a value of type string.
foregroundColor.title: Foregroundcolor

hidden.description: Whether calendar is hidden. Please provide a value of type boolean.
hidden.title: Hidden

selected.description: Whether calendar content shows in UI. Please provide a value of type boolean.
selected.title: Selected

summaryOverride.description: User-set summary for the calendar. Please provide a value of type string.
summaryOverride.title: Summaryoverride

value.description: Updates an existing entry on the user\'s calendar list.
value.display_description: Updates an existing entry on the user\'s calendar list.
value.name: googlecalendar_calendar_list_update

calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

value.description: Deletes a secondary calendar. Use calendars.clear for clearing all events on primary calendars.
value.display_description: Deletes a secondary calendar. Use calendars.clear for clearing all events on primary calendars.
value.name: googlecalendar_calendars_delete

calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendarId.title: Calendarid

description.description: Description of the calendar. Optional. Please provide a value of type string.
description.title: Description

location.description: Geographic location of the calendar as free-form text. Optional. Please provide a value of type string.
location.title: Location

summary.description: Title of the calendar. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
summary.title: Summary

timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar. (Formatted as an IANA Time Zone Database name, e.g. "Europe/Zurich".) Optional. Please provide a value of type string.
timeZone.title: Timezone

value.description: Updates metadata for a calendar.
value.display_description: Updates metadata for a calendar.
value.name: googlecalendar_calendars_update

calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the `calendarList.list` method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "`primary`" keyword. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

value.description: Clears a primary calendar. This operation deletes all events associated with the primary calendar of an account.
value.display_description: Clears a primary calendar. This operation deletes all events associated with the primary calendar of an account.
value.name: googlecalendar_clear_calendar

attendees.description: List of valid attendee email addresses. Each string must be a valid email address (e.g., user@example.com, john.doe@company.org). Invalid email formats will be rejected by the Google Calendar API.
attendees.title: Attendees

calendar_id.description: Target calendar: 'primary' for the user's main calendar, or the calendar's email address. Must be provided in snake_case format. Please provide a value of type string.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

create_meeting_room.description: Defaults to True. When True, attempts to create a Google Meet link for the event. Google Workspace accounts will successfully receive a Meet link. Personal Gmail accounts and other unsupported accounts will gracefully fallback to creating an event without a Meet link when conference creation fails. Set to False to explicitly skip Meet link creation without any retry attempts. The fallback ensures event creation succeeds even when conference features are unavailable due to account limitations. Please provide a value of type boolean.
create_meeting_room.title: Create Meeting Room

description.description: Description of the event. Can contain HTML. Optional. Must be omitted for 'birthday' event type. Please provide a value of type string.
description.title: Description

eventType.description: Type of the event, immutable post-creation. 'workingLocation' (REQUIRES Google Workspace Enterprise). Note: 'fromGmail' events cannot be created via API. Please provide a value of type string.
eventType.title: Eventtype

event_duration_hour.description: Number of hours for the event duration. Supports multi-day events (e.g., 240 hours = 10 days). For durations under 1 hour, use event_duration_minutes instead. Please provide a value of type integer.
event_duration_hour.title: Event Duration Hour

event_duration_minutes.description: Duration in minutes (0-59 ONLY). NEVER use 60+ minutes - use event_duration_hour=1 instead. Maximum value is 59. Combined duration (hours + minutes) must be greater than 0. Please provide a value of type integer.
event_duration_minutes.title: Event Duration Minutes

exclude_organizer.description: If True, the organizer will NOT be added as an attendee. Default is False (organizer is included). Please provide a value of type boolean.
exclude_organizer.title: Exclude Organizer

extended_properties.description: Extended properties of the event for storing custom metadata. Contains 'private' (visible only on this calendar) and/or 'shared' (visible to all attendees) dictionaries mapping string keys to string values. Example: {'private': {'key1': 'value1'}, 'shared': {'key2': 'value2'}}
extended_properties.title: Extended Properties

focusTimeProperties.description: Properties for focusTime events. REQUIRES Google Workspace Enterprise account with Focus Time feature enabled.

guestsCanInviteOthers.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can invite others to the event. Please provide a value of type boolean.
guestsCanInviteOthers.title: Guestscaninviteothers

guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can see who the event's attendees are. Please provide a value of type boolean.
guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.title: Guestscanseeotherguests

guests_can_modify.description: If True, guests can modify the event. Please provide a value of type boolean.
guests_can_modify.title: Guests Can Modify

location.description: Geographic location of the event as free-form text. Please provide a value of type string.
location.title: Location

recurrence.description: List of RRULE, EXRULE, RDATE, EXDATE lines for recurring events. Supported frequencies: DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, YEARLY. For recurring events, start.timeZone and end.timeZone must be present. UNTIL values follow RFC 5545: date-only (YYYYMMDD) for all-day events, or UTC datetime with Z suffix (YYYYMMDDTHHMMSSZ) for timed events. UNTIL values with time but missing Z suffix are auto-corrected. Provide an empty list to remove recurrence so the event becomes non-recurring.
recurrence.title: Recurrence

send_updates.description: Defaults to True. Whether to send updates to the attendees. Please provide a value of type boolean.
send_updates.title: Send Updates

start_datetime.description: REQUIRED. Event start time in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS. IMPORTANT: Natural language expressions like 'tomorrow', 'next Monday', '2pm tomorrow' are NOT supported and will be rejected. You must provide the exact date and time in ISO format. Fractional seconds (e.g., .000) and timezone info (Z, +, -) will be automatically stripped if provided. Examples: '2025-01-16T13:00:00', '2025-01-16T13:00'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
start_datetime.title: Start Datetime

summary.description: Summary (title) of the event. Please provide a value of type string.
summary.title: Summary

timezone.description: IANA timezone name (e.g., 'America/New_York'). Required if datetime is naive. For recurring events, start and end must include a timeZone. If not provided, UTC is used. If datetime includes timezone info (Z or offset), this field is optional and defaults to UTC. Please provide a value of type string.
timezone.title: Timezone

transparency.description: 'opaque' (busy) or 'transparent' (available). Please provide a value of type string.
transparency.title: Transparency

visibility.description: Event visibility: 'default', 'public', 'private', or 'confidential'. Please provide a value of type string.
visibility.title: Visibility

workingLocationProperties.description:
Properties for workingLocation events. REQUIRES Google Workspace Enterprise.

Constraints discovered from testing:
- Must set transparency='transparent' and visibility='public'
- Description must be omitted
- Depending on 'type', include one of 'homeOffice', 'officeLocation', or 'customLocation'

value.description: Create a Google Calendar event using `start_datetime` plus `event_duration_hour` and `event_duration_minutes` fields to derive the end time. Requires calendar write access. The organizer is added as an attendee unless `exclude_organizer` is True. By default, attempts to create a Google Meet link for the event (create_meeting_room defaults to True). Workspace accounts will receive a Meet link, while personal Gmail accounts will gracefully fallback to creating an event without a Meet link when conference creation fails. Set create_meeting_room to False to explicitly skip Meet link creation. Example request to create event for 1 hour 30 minutes: { "calendar_id": "primary", "start_datetime": "2025-01-16T13:00:00", "timezone": "America/New_York", "event_duration_hour": 1, "event_duration_minutes": 30, "summary": "Client sync", "attendees": [{"email": "guest@example.com"}] }
value.display_description: Create a Google Calendar event using `start_datetime` plus `event_duration_hour` and `event_duration_minutes` fields to derive the end time. Requires calendar write access. The organizer is added as an attendee unless `exclude_organizer` is True. By default, attempts to create a Google Meet link for the event (create_meeting_room defaults to True). Workspace accounts will receive a Meet link, while personal Gmail accounts will gracefully fallback to creating an event without a Meet link when conference creation fails. Set create_meeting_room to False to explicitly skip Meet link creation. Example request to create event for 1 hour 30 minutes: { "calendar_id": "primary", "start_datetime": "2025-01-16T13:00:00", "timezone": "America/New_York", "event_duration_hour": 1, "event_duration_minutes": 30, "summary": "Client sync", "attendees": [{"email": "guest@example.com"}] }
value.name: googlecalendar_create_event

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar (e.g., email address, specific ID, or 'primary' for the authenticated user's main calendar) from which the event will be deleted. Please provide a value of type string.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

event_id.description: Unique identifier of the event to delete, typically obtained upon event creation. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
event_id.title: Event Id

value.description: Deletes a specified event by `event_id` from a Google Calendar (`calendar_id`); this action is idempotent and raises a 404 error if the event is not found.
value.display_description: Deletes a specified event by `event_id` from a Google Calendar (`calendar_id`); this action is idempotent and raises a 404 error if the event is not found.
value.name: googlecalendar_delete_event

summary.description: Title for the new Google Calendar to be created. Required and must be a non-empty string. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
summary.title: Summary

value.description: Creates a new, empty Google Calendar with the specified title (summary).
value.display_description: Creates a new, empty Google Calendar with the specified title (summary).
value.name: googlecalendar_duplicate_calendar

calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the `calendarList.list` method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendarId.title: Calendarid

eventId.description: Recurring event identifier. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
eventId.title: Eventid

maxAttendees.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned. Optional. Please provide a value of type integer.
maxAttendees.title: Maxattendees

maxResults.description: Maximum number of events returned on one result page. By default the value is 250 events. The page size can never be larger than 2500 events. Optional. Please provide a value of type integer.
maxResults.title: Maxresults

originalStart.description: The original start time of the instance in the result. Optional. Please provide a value of type string.
originalStart.title: Originalstart

pageToken.description: Token specifying which result page to return. Optional. Please provide a value of type string.
pageToken.title: Pagetoken

showDeleted.description: Whether to include deleted events (with status equals "cancelled") in the result. Cancelled instances of recurring events will still be included if `singleEvents` is False. Optional. The default is False. Please provide a value of type boolean.
showDeleted.title: Showdeleted

timeMax.description: Upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by start time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset. Please provide a value of type string.
timeMax.title: Timemax

timeMin.description: Lower bound (inclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by end time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset. Please provide a value of type string.
timeMin.title: Timemin

timeZone.description: Time zone used in the response. Optional. The default is the time zone of the calendar. Please provide a value of type string.
timeZone.title: Timezone

value.description: Returns instances of the specified recurring event.
value.display_description: Returns instances of the specified recurring event.
value.name: googlecalendar_events_instances

alwaysIncludeEmail.description: Deprecated and ignored. Please provide a value of type boolean.
alwaysIncludeEmail.title: Alwaysincludeemail

calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword. Defaults to "primary". Empty strings will be treated as "primary". Please provide a value of type string.
calendarId.title: Calendarid

eventTypes.description: Event types to return. Optional. Pass a single value only. If unset, returns all event types. Acceptable values are: "birthday", "default", "focusTime", "fromGmail", "outOfOffice", "workingLocation". Please provide a value of type string.
eventTypes.title: Eventtypes

iCalUID.description: Specifies an event ID in the iCalendar format to be provided in the response. Optional. Use this if you want to search for an event by its iCalendar ID. Please provide a value of type string.
iCalUID.title: Icaluid

maxAttendees.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned. Optional. Must be >= 1 if provided. Please provide a value of type integer.
maxAttendees.title: Maxattendees

maxResults.description: Maximum number of events returned on one result page. The number of events in the resulting page may be less than this value, or none at all, even if there are more events matching the query. Incomplete pages can be detected by a non-empty nextPageToken field in the response. By default the value is 250 events. The page size can never be larger than 2500 events. Optional. Please provide a value of type integer.
maxResults.title: Maxresults

orderBy.description: The order of the events returned in the result. Optional. The default is an unspecified, stable order. Acceptable values are: "startTime", "updated". When set to "startTime", singleEvents must be true. The action automatically sets singleEvents=true when orderBy='startTime'. Please provide a value of type string.
orderBy.title: Orderby

pageToken.description: Token specifying which result page to return. Optional. Please provide a value of type string.
pageToken.title: Pagetoken

privateExtendedProperty.description: Extended properties constraint specified as propertyName=value. Matches only private properties. This parameter might be repeated multiple times to return events that match all given constraints. Please provide a value of type string.
privateExtendedProperty.title: Privateextendedproperty

q.description: Free text search terms to find events that match these terms in various fields. Optional. Please provide a value of type string.
q.title: Q

sharedExtendedProperty.description: Extended properties constraint specified as propertyName=value. Matches only shared properties. This parameter might be repeated multiple times to return events that match all given constraints. Please provide a value of type string.
sharedExtendedProperty.title: Sharedextendedproperty

showDeleted.description: Include cancelled events (status="cancelled"). Optional; default is false. This surfaces cancelled (soft-deleted) events, not items in the Trash. When syncToken or updatedMin is used, deletions since those markers are included regardless of showDeleted. Recurring interaction: if singleEvents=false and showDeleted=false, cancelled instances of a recurring series may still be included; if showDeleted=true and singleEvents=true, only single deleted instances (not parent series) are returned. Please provide a value of type boolean.
showDeleted.title: Showdeleted

showHiddenInvitations.description: Whether to include hidden invitations in the result. Optional. The default is False. Hidden invitations are events where your attendee entry has responseStatus='needsAction' and attendees[].self==true. When true, such invitations are included. Please provide a value of type boolean.
showHiddenInvitations.title: Showhiddeninvitations

singleEvents.description: Whether to expand recurring events into instances and only return single one-off events and instances of recurring events. Optional. The default is False. Please provide a value of type boolean.
singleEvents.title: Singleevents

syncToken.description: Token from nextSyncToken to return only entries changed since the last list. Cannot be combined with iCalUID, orderBy, privateExtendedProperty, q, sharedExtendedProperty, timeMin, timeMax, or updatedMin. Deletions since the previous list are always included; showDeleted cannot be false in this mode. The action automatically removes conflicting parameters when syncToken is provided. Please provide a value of type string.
syncToken.title: Synctoken

timeMax.description: Upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. Optional. If unset, no start-time upper bound is applied. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset (e.g., 2011-06-03T10:00:00-07:00 or 2011-06-03T10:00:00Z). Milliseconds may be provided but are ignored. If timeMin is set, timeMax must be greater than timeMin. Please provide a value of type string.
timeMax.title: Timemax

timeMin.description: Lower bound (exclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. Optional. If unset, no end-time lower bound is applied. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset (e.g., 2011-06-03T10:00:00-07:00 or 2011-06-03T10:00:00Z). Milliseconds may be provided but are ignored. If timeMax is set, timeMin must be smaller than timeMax. Please provide a value of type string.
timeMin.title: Timemin

timeZone.description: Time zone used in the response. Optional. Use an IANA time zone identifier (e.g., America/Los_Angeles). Defaults to the user's primary time zone. Offsets (e.g., '-03:00', 'UTC+0') and abbreviations (e.g., 'IST', 'PST') are invalid. Please provide a value of type string.
timeZone.title: Timezone

updatedMin.description: Lower bound for an event's last modification time (RFC3339). When specified, entries deleted since this time are always included regardless of showDeleted. Optional. Please provide a value of type string.
updatedMin.title: Updatedmin

value.description: Returns events on the specified calendar.
value.display_description: Returns events on the specified calendar.
value.name: googlecalendar_events_list

calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier of the source calendar. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

destination.description: Calendar identifier of the destination calendar. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
destination.title: Destination

event_id.description: Event identifier. To retrieve event identifiers call the events.list method. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
event_id.title: Event Id

send_updates.description: Guests who should receive notifications about the change of the event's organizer. Acceptable values are: "all": Notifications are sent to all guests. "externalOnly": Notifications are sent to non-Google Calendar guests only. "none": No notifications are sent. This is the default value if left unspecified. Please provide a value of type string.
send_updates.title: Send Updates

value.description: Moves an event to another calendar, i.e., changes an event's organizer.
value.display_description: Moves an event to another calendar, i.e., changes an event's organizer.
value.name: googlecalendar_events_move

address.description: The address where notifications are delivered for this channel. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
address.title: Address

calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendarId.title: Calendarid

id.description: A UUID or similar unique string that identifies this channel. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
id.title: Id

params.description: Additional parameters controlling delivery channel behavior. Optional.

payload.description: A Boolean value to indicate whether payload is wanted. Optional. Please provide a value of type boolean.
payload.title: Payload

token.description: An arbitrary string delivered to the target address with each notification delivered over this channel. Optional. Please provide a value of type string.
token.title: Token

type.description: The type of delivery mechanism used for this channel. Please provide a value of type string.
type.title: Type

value.description: Watch for changes to Events resources.
value.display_description: Watch for changes to Events resources.
value.name: googlecalendar_events_watch

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar to query. Use 'primary' for the primary calendar of the authenticated user, an email address for a specific user's calendar, or a calendar ID for other calendars. Please provide a value of type string.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

event_types.description: Event types to include. Supported values: 'birthday', 'default', 'focusTime', 'outOfOffice', 'workingLocation'.
event_types.title: Event Types

max_results.description: Maximum number of events per page (1-2500). Please provide a value of type integer.
max_results.title: Max Results

order_by.description: Order of events: 'startTime' (ascending by start time) or 'updated' (ascending by last modification time). Note: 'startTime' requires single_events=true. Use 'updated' if you need to include recurring masters (e.g., cancelled series). Please provide a value of type string.
order_by.title: Order By

page_token.description: Token from a previous response's `nextPageToken` to fetch the subsequent page of results. Please provide a value of type string.
page_token.title: Page Token

query.description: Free-text search terms to find events. This query is matched against various event fields including summary, description, location, attendees' details (displayName, email), and organizer's details. Please provide a value of type string.
query.title: Query

show_deleted.description: Include events whose status is 'cancelled'. This surfaces cancelled/deleted events, not a separate 'trash' view. Behavior with recurring events: when single_events=true, only individual cancelled instances are returned (the recurring master is omitted); to include cancelled recurring masters, set single_events=false. If updated_min is provided, events deleted since that time are included regardless of this flag. Please provide a value of type boolean.
show_deleted.title: Show Deleted

single_events.description: When true, recurring event series are expanded into their individual instances. When false, only the recurring master events are returned. Note: Ordering by 'startTime' requires singleEvents=true. For large calendars, it is strongly recommended to specify both timeMin and timeMax to limit the expansion window and improve performance. Please provide a value of type boolean.
single_events.title: Single Events

timeMax.description:
Upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. Only events starting before this time are included. Accepts multiple formats:
1. RFC3339 timestamp (e.g., '2024-12-06T13:00:00Z')
2. Comma-separated date/time parts (e.g., '2024,12,06,13,00,00')
3. Simple datetime string (e.g., '2024-12-06 13:00:00'). Please provide a value of type string.
timeMax.title: Timemax

timeMin.description:
Lower bound (exclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. Only events ending after this time are included. Accepts multiple formats:
1. RFC3339 timestamp (e.g., '2024-12-06T13:00:00Z')
2. Comma-separated date/time parts (e.g., '2024,12,06,13,00,00')
3. Simple datetime string (e.g., '2024-12-06 13:00:00'). Please provide a value of type string.
timeMin.title: Timemin

updated_min.description:
Lower bound (exclusive) for an event's last modification time to filter by. Only events updated after this time are included. When specified, events deleted since this time are also included, regardless of the `show_deleted` parameter. Accepts multiple formats:
1. RFC3339 timestamp (e.g., '2024-12-06T13:00:00Z')
2. Comma-separated date/time parts (e.g., '2024,12,06,13,00,00')
3. Simple datetime string (e.g., '2024-12-06 13:00:00'). Please provide a value of type string.
updated_min.title: Updated Min

value.description: Finds events in a specified Google Calendar using text query, time ranges (event start/end, last modification), and event types; ensure `timeMin` is not chronologically after `timeMax` if both are provided.
value.display_description: Finds events in a specified Google Calendar using text query, time ranges (event start/end, last modification), and event types; ensure `timeMin` is not chronologically after `timeMax` if both are provided.
value.name: googlecalendar_find_event

calendar_expansion_max.description: Maximum calendars for which FreeBusy information is provided. Max allowed: 50. Please provide a value of type integer.
calendar_expansion_max.title: Calendar Expansion Max

group_expansion_max.description: Maximum calendar identifiers to return for a single group; exceeding this causes an error. Max allowed: 100. Please provide a value of type integer.
group_expansion_max.title: Group Expansion Max

items.description: List of calendar identifiers to query for free/busy information. Each item must be a valid calendar identifier: 'primary' for the user's main calendar, a user/calendar email (e.g., user@example.com), or a calendar ID ending with a Google Calendar domain (e.g., ...@group.calendar.google.com). Only calendars accessible to the authenticated account are allowed. All identifiers are validated; if any is invalid or not found, the action returns an error.
items.title: Items

time_max.description: End datetime for the query interval. Accepts ISO, comma-separated, or simple datetime formats. If provided without an explicit timezone, it is interpreted in the specified `timezone`. Maximum span between time_min and time_max is approximately 90 days per Google Calendar freeBusy API limit. Please provide a value of type string.
time_max.title: Time Max

time_min.description: Start datetime for the query interval. Accepts ISO, comma-separated, or simple datetime formats. If provided without an explicit timezone, it is interpreted in the specified `timezone`. Maximum span between time_min and time_max is approximately 90 days per Google Calendar freeBusy API limit. Please provide a value of type string.
time_min.title: Time Min

timezone.description: IANA timezone identifier (e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Europe/London', 'Asia/Tokyo'). Determines how naive `time_min`/`time_max` are interpreted and the timezone used in the response for `timeMin`, `timeMax`, busy periods, and calculated free slots. Note: 'local' is not supported; use a specific IANA timezone name. Please provide a value of type string.
timezone.title: Timezone

value.description: Finds both free and busy time slots in Google Calendars for specified calendars within a defined time range (defaults to the current day UTC if `time_min`/`time_max` are omitted). Returns busy intervals enriched with event details and calculates free slots by finding gaps between busy periods; `time_min` must precede `time_max` if both are provided. This action retrieves free and busy time slots for the specified calendars over a given time period. It analyzes the busy intervals from the calendars and provides calculated free slots based on the gaps in the busy periods.
value.display_description: Finds both free and busy time slots in Google Calendars for specified calendars within a defined time range (defaults to the current day UTC if `time_min`/`time_max` are omitted). Returns busy intervals enriched with event details and calculates free slots by finding gaps between busy periods; `time_min` must precede `time_max` if both are provided. This action retrieves free and busy time slots for the specified calendars over a given time period. It analyzes the busy intervals from the calendars and provides calculated free slots based on the gaps in the busy periods.
value.name: googlecalendar_find_free_slots

calendarExpansionMax.description: Maximal number of calendars for which FreeBusy information is to be provided. Optional. Maximum value is 50. Please provide a value of type integer.
calendarExpansionMax.title: Calendarexpansionmax

groupExpansionMax.description: Maximal number of calendar identifiers to be provided for a single group. Optional. An error is returned for a group with more members than this value. Maximum value is 100. Please provide a value of type integer.
groupExpansionMax.title: Groupexpansionmax

items.description: List of calendars and/or groups to query. Accepts either strings (e.g., ['primary', 'user@example.com']) or objects with an 'id' field (e.g., [{'id': 'primary'}]). String values are automatically converted to the proper format. This parameter is required.
items.title: Items

timeMax.description: The end of the interval for the query formatted as per RFC3339. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
timeMax.title: Timemax

timeMin.description: The start of the interval for the query formatted as per RFC3339. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
timeMin.title: Timemin

timeZone.description: Time zone used in the response. Optional. The default is UTC. Please provide a value of type string.
timeZone.title: Timezone

value.description: Returns free/busy information for a set of calendars.
value.display_description: Returns free/busy information for a set of calendars.
value.name: googlecalendar_free_busy_query

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar to retrieve. Must be 'primary' (the default) for the user's main calendar, or an email-like identifier (e.g., 'user@example.com' or 'en.usa#holiday@group.v.calendar.google.com'). IMPORTANT: Calendar display names/titles (e.g., 'Work', 'Vacation') are NOT valid identifiers and will result in errors. To find a calendar's ID, use the LIST_CALENDARS action which returns the 'id' field for each calendar. Please provide a value of type string.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

value.description: Retrieves a specific Google Calendar, identified by `calendar_id`, to which the authenticated user has access.
value.display_description: Retrieves a specific Google Calendar, identified by `calendar_id`, to which the authenticated user has access.
value.name: googlecalendar_get_calendar

timezone.description: Timezone specification. Accepts: (1) IANA timezone identifier (e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Asia/Kolkata', 'Europe/London') - RECOMMENDED, (2) Common timezone abbreviations (e.g., 'PST', 'EST', 'CST', 'GMT', 'UTC') - will be auto-converted to IANA, or (3) Numeric UTC offset in hours (e.g., -5, 5.5). Use positive values for east of UTC, negative for west. Default 0 is UTC. Please provide a value of type string.
timezone.title: Timezone

value.description: Gets the current date and time, allowing for a specific timezone offset.
value.display_description: Gets the current date and time, allowing for a specific timezone offset.
value.name: googlecalendar_get_current_date_time

calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

max_results.description: Maximum number of entries returned on one result page. Optional. The default is 100. Please provide a value of type integer.
max_results.title: Max Results

page_token.description: Token specifying which result page to return. Optional. Please provide a value of type string.
page_token.title: Page Token

show_deleted.description: Whether to include deleted ACLs in the result. Optional. The default is False. Please provide a value of type boolean.
show_deleted.title: Show Deleted

sync_token.description: Token obtained from the nextSyncToken field returned on the last page of a previous list operation. It makes the result of this list operation contain only entries that have changed since then. Optional. The default is to retrieve all entries. Please provide a value of type string.
sync_token.title: Sync Token

value.description: Retrieves the list of access control rules (ACLs) for a specified calendar, providing the necessary 'rule_id' values required for updating specific ACL rules.
value.display_description: Retrieves the list of access control rules (ACLs) for a specified calendar, providing the necessary 'rule_id' values required for updating specific ACL rules.
value.name: googlecalendar_list_acl_rules

maxResults.description: Maximum number of calendars to return per page. Maximum allowed value is 250. Please provide a value of type integer.
maxResults.title: Maxresults

minAccessRole.description: Minimum access role the user must have for the returned calendars. Please provide a value of type string.
minAccessRole.title: Minaccessrole

pageToken.description: Token for retrieving a specific page of results from a previous list operation. Please provide a value of type string.
pageToken.title: Pagetoken

showDeleted.description: Include calendar list entries deleted from the user's list. Deleted entries are returned with the 'deleted' field set to true. When using 'syncToken', deleted (and hidden) entries changed since the previous list are always included, and this parameter must not be set to false. Please provide a value of type boolean.
showDeleted.title: Showdeleted

showHidden.description: Include calendars hidden in the user interface. When using 'syncToken', hidden (and deleted) entries changed since the previous list are always included, and this parameter must not be set to false. Please provide a value of type boolean.
showHidden.title: Showhidden

syncToken.description: Sync token from a previous list request's 'nextSyncToken' to retrieve only entries changed since the last sync. When provided, only 'syncToken' and optionally 'pageToken' are used; other filters are ignored. 'minAccessRole' cannot be combined with 'syncToken'. Please provide a value of type string.
syncToken.title: Synctoken

value.description: Retrieves a paginated list of calendars from the user's calendar list, with optional filtering and sync capabilities.
value.display_description: Retrieves a paginated list of calendars from the user's calendar list, with optional filtering and sync capabilities.
value.name: googlecalendar_list_calendars

calendar_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Calendar to update. Use 'primary' for the main calendar, or a calendar's unique ID (typically in email format like 'abc123@group.calendar.google.com'). IMPORTANT: This is NOT the calendar's display name/title - use GOOGLECALENDAR_LIST_CALENDARS to find the 'id' field for a calendar. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

description.description: New description for the calendar. Please provide a value of type string.
description.title: Description

location.description: New geographic location of the calendar (e.g., 'Paris, France'). Please provide a value of type string.
location.title: Location

summary.description: New title for the calendar; cannot be an empty string. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
summary.title: Summary

timezone.description: New IANA Time Zone Database name for the calendar (e.g., 'Europe/Zurich', 'America/New_York'). Please provide a value of type string.
timezone.title: Timezone

value.description: Partially updates (PATCHes) an existing Google Calendar, modifying only the fields provided; `summary` is mandatory and cannot be an empty string, and an empty string for `description` or `location` clears them.
value.display_description: Partially updates (PATCHes) an existing Google Calendar, modifying only the fields provided; `summary` is mandatory and cannot be an empty string, and an empty string for `description` or `location` clears them.
value.name: googlecalendar_patch_calendar

attendees.description: List of email addresses for attendees. Replaces existing attendees. Provide an empty list to remove all.
attendees.title: Attendees

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the calendar. Use 'primary' for the primary calendar of the logged-in user. To find other calendar IDs, use the `calendarList.list` method. Must be provided in snake_case format. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

conference_data_version.description: API client's conference data support version. Set to 1 to manage conference details (e.g., Google Meet links); 0 (default) ignores conference data. Please provide a value of type integer.
conference_data_version.title: Conference Data Version

description.description: New description for the event; can include HTML. Please provide a value of type string.
examples: Weekly team sync meeting to discuss project updates.
description.title: Description

end_time.description: New end time (RFC3339 timestamp, e.g., '2024-07-01T11:00:00-07:00'). Uses `timezone` if provided, otherwise UTC. For all-day events, use YYYY-MM-DD format (exclusive end date). Please provide a value of type string.
end_time.title: End Time

event_id.description: The unique technical identifier of the event to update. IMPORTANT: This is NOT the event title/name. Event IDs are opaque strings like 'pna920peji8r3jj2a18m6bk8ms' (base32hex encoded, 5-1024 characters using lowercase a-v and digits 0-9). To get an event ID, first use 'GOOGLECALENDAR_LIST_OR_FIND_EVENTS' or 'GOOGLECALENDAR_EVENTS_LIST' to search for events and retrieve their IDs. For example, if you want to update an event titled 'Team Meeting', first list events to find the event ID, then use that ID here. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
event_id.title: Event Id

location.description: New geographic location (physical address or virtual meeting link). Please provide a value of type string.
location.title: Location

max_attendees.description: Maximum attendees in response; does not affect invited count. If more, response includes organizer only. Must be positive. Please provide a value of type integer.
max_attendees.title: Max Attendees

rsvp_response.description: RSVP response status for the authenticated user. Updates only the current user's response status without affecting other attendees. Possible values: 'needsAction', 'declined', 'tentative', 'accepted'. Please provide a value of type string.
rsvp_response.title: Rsvp Response

send_updates.description: Whether to send update notifications to attendees: 'all', 'externalOnly', or 'none'. Uses default user behavior if unspecified. Please provide a value of type string.
send_updates.title: Send Updates

start_time.description: New start time (RFC3339 timestamp, e.g., '2024-07-01T10:00:00-07:00'). Uses `timezone` if provided, otherwise UTC. For all-day events, use YYYY-MM-DD format. Please provide a value of type string.
start_time.title: Start Time

summary.description: New title for the event. Please provide a value of type string.
summary.title: Summary

supports_attachments.description: Client application supports event attachments. Set to `True` if so. Please provide a value of type boolean.
supports_attachments.title: Supports Attachments

timezone.description: IANA Time Zone Database name for start/end times (e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'). Used if `start_time` and `end_time` are provided and not all-day dates; defaults to UTC if unset. Please provide a value of type string.
timezone.title: Timezone

value.description: Update specified fields of an existing event in a Google Calendar using patch semantics (array fields like `attendees` are fully replaced if provided); ensure the `calendar_id` and `event_id` are valid and the user has write access to the calendar.
value.display_description: Update specified fields of an existing event in a Google Calendar using patch semantics (array fields like `attendees` are fully replaced if provided); ensure the `calendar_id` and `event_id` are valid and the user has write access to the calendar.
value.name: googlecalendar_patch_event

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the calendar for the event. Use 'primary' for the main calendar, or provide a specific calendar ID (e.g., email address). Please provide a value of type string.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

send_updates.description: Controls whether email notifications about the event creation are sent to attendees. Please provide a value of type string.
send_updates.title: Send Updates

text.description: Natural language input describing the event; Google Calendar parses this for event details like title, date, and time. Please provide a value of type string.
examples: Dentist appointment tomorrow at 2pm for 45 minutes
text.title: Text

value.description: Parses natural language text to quickly create a basic Google Calendar event with its title, date, and time, suitable for simple scheduling; does not support direct attendee addition or recurring events, and `calendar_id` must be valid if not 'primary'.
value.display_description: Parses natural language text to quickly create a basic Google Calendar event with its title, date, and time, suitable for simple scheduling; does not support direct attendee addition or recurring events, and `calendar_id` must be valid if not 'primary'.
value.name: googlecalendar_quick_add

attendee_email.description: Email address of the attendee to remove. Must match an attendee email present on the event. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
attendee_email.title: Attendee Email

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar to which the event belongs; 'primary' signifies the user's main calendar. Please provide a value of type string.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

event_id.description: Unique identifier of the event. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
event_id.title: Event Id

value.description: Removes an attendee from a specified event in a Google Calendar; the calendar and event must exist.
value.display_description: Removes an attendee from a specified event in a Google Calendar; the calendar and event must exist.
value.name: googlecalendar_remove_attendee

maxResults.description: Maximum number of entries returned on one result page. By default the value is 100 entries. The page size can never be larger than 250 entries. Please provide a value of type integer.
maxResults.title: Maxresults

pageToken.description: Token specifying which result page to return. Please provide a value of type string.
pageToken.title: Pagetoken

syncToken.description: Token obtained from the nextSyncToken field returned on the last page of results from the previous list request. It makes the result of this list request contain only entries that have changed since then. If the syncToken expires, the server will respond with a 410 GONE response code and the client should clear its storage and perform a full synchronization without any syncToken. Please provide a value of type string.
syncToken.title: Synctoken

value.description: Returns all user settings for the authenticated user.
value.display_description: Returns all user settings for the authenticated user.
value.name: googlecalendar_settings_list

address.description: The address where notifications are delivered for this channel. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
address.title: Address

id.description: A UUID or similar unique string that identifies this channel. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
id.title: Id

params.description: Additional parameters controlling delivery channel behavior.

token.description: An arbitrary string delivered to the target address with each notification delivered over this channel. Please provide a value of type string.
token.title: Token

type.description: The type of delivery mechanism used for this channel. Valid values are "web_hook" (or "webhook"). Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
type.title: Type

value.description: Watch for changes to Settings resources.
value.display_description: Watch for changes to Settings resources.
value.name: googlecalendar_settings_watch

calendar_id.description: Google Calendar identifier; 'primary' refers to the authenticated user's main calendar. Please provide a value of type string.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

event_types.description: Filters events by specified types (e.g., 'default', 'focusTime', 'outOfOffice', 'workingLocation'). All types returned if omitted.
event_types.title: Event Types

max_results.description: Max events per page (max 2500); Google Calendar's default is used if unspecified. Please provide a value of type integer.
max_results.title: Max Results

pageToken.description: Token for paginating results, from a previous response's `nextPageToken`. Please provide a value of type string.
pageToken.title: Pagetoken

single_events.description: If True, expands recurring events into individual instances (excluding master event); otherwise, Google's default handling applies. Please provide a value of type boolean.
single_events.title: Single Events

sync_token.description: Token for incremental sync, retrieving only changes since issued. A 410 GONE response indicates an expired token, requiring a full sync. Please provide a value of type string.
sync_token.title: Sync Token

value.description: Synchronizes Google Calendar events, performing a full sync if no `sync_token` is provided or if a 410 GONE error (due to an expired token) necessitates it, otherwise performs an incremental sync for events changed since the `sync_token` was issued.
value.display_description: Synchronizes Google Calendar events, performing a full sync if no `sync_token` is provided or if a 410 GONE error (due to an expired token) necessitates it, otherwise performs an incremental sync for events changed since the `sync_token` was issued.
value.name: googlecalendar_sync_events

calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

role.description:
The role assigned to the scope. Possible values are: 
- "none" - Provides no access. 
- "freeBusyReader" - Provides read access to free/busy information. 
- "reader" - Provides read access to the calendar. Private events will appear to users with reader access, but event details will be hidden. 
- "writer" - Provides read and write access to the calendar. Private events will appear to users with writer access, and event details will be visible. 
- "owner" - Provides ownership of the calendar. This role has all of the permissions of the writer role with the additional ability to see and manipulate ACLs. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
role.title: Role

rule_id.description: ACL rule identifier. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
rule_id.title: Rule Id

send_notifications.description: Whether to send notifications about the calendar sharing change. Note that there are no notifications on access removal. Optional. The default is True. Please provide a value of type boolean.
send_notifications.title: Send Notifications

value.description: Updates an access control rule for the specified calendar.
value.display_description: Updates an access control rule for the specified calendar.
value.name: googlecalendar_update_acl_rule

attendees.description: List of valid attendee email addresses. Each string must be a valid email address (e.g., user@example.com, john.doe@company.org). Invalid email formats will be rejected by the Google Calendar API.
attendees.title: Attendees

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar where the event resides. The value 'primary' targets the user's primary calendar. Please provide a value of type string.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

create_meeting_room.description: Defaults to True. When True, attempts to create a Google Meet link for the event. Google Workspace accounts will successfully receive a Meet link. Personal Gmail accounts and other unsupported accounts will gracefully fallback to creating an event without a Meet link when conference creation fails. Set to False to explicitly skip Meet link creation without any retry attempts. The fallback ensures event creation succeeds even when conference features are unavailable due to account limitations. Please provide a value of type boolean.
create_meeting_room.title: Create Meeting Room

description.description: Description of the event. Can contain HTML. Optional. Must be omitted for 'birthday' event type. Please provide a value of type string.
description.title: Description

eventType.description: Type of the event, immutable post-creation. 'workingLocation' (REQUIRES Google Workspace Enterprise). Note: 'fromGmail' events cannot be created via API. Please provide a value of type string.
eventType.title: Eventtype

event_duration_hour.description: Number of hours for the event duration. Supports multi-day events (e.g., 240 hours = 10 days). For durations under 1 hour, use event_duration_minutes instead. Please provide a value of type integer.
event_duration_hour.title: Event Duration Hour

event_duration_minutes.description: Duration in minutes (0-59 ONLY). NEVER use 60+ minutes - use event_duration_hour=1 instead. Maximum value is 59. Combined duration (hours + minutes) must be greater than 0. Please provide a value of type integer.
event_duration_minutes.title: Event Duration Minutes

event_id.description: REQUIRED. The unique identifier of the event to update. This parameter is MANDATORY - events cannot be updated by title, date, or other criteria. You MUST first retrieve the event_id by using GOOGLECALENDAR_FIND_EVENT or GOOGLECALENDAR_EVENTS_LIST to search for the event, then use the returned 'id' field here. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
event_id.title: Event Id

extended_properties.description: Extended properties of the event for storing custom metadata. Contains 'private' (visible only on this calendar) and/or 'shared' (visible to all attendees) dictionaries mapping string keys to string values. Example: {'private': {'key1': 'value1'}, 'shared': {'key2': 'value2'}}
extended_properties.title: Extended Properties

focusTimeProperties.description: Properties for focusTime events. REQUIRES Google Workspace Enterprise account with Focus Time feature enabled.

guestsCanInviteOthers.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can invite others to the event. Please provide a value of type boolean.
guestsCanInviteOthers.title: Guestscaninviteothers

guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can see who the event's attendees are. Please provide a value of type boolean.
guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.title: Guestscanseeotherguests

guests_can_modify.description: If True, guests can modify the event. Please provide a value of type boolean.
guests_can_modify.title: Guests Can Modify

location.description: Geographic location of the event as free-form text. Please provide a value of type string.
location.title: Location

recurrence.description: List of RRULE, EXRULE, RDATE, EXDATE lines for recurring events. Supported frequencies: DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, YEARLY. For recurring events, start.timeZone and end.timeZone must be present. UNTIL values follow RFC 5545: date-only (YYYYMMDD) for all-day events, or UTC datetime with Z suffix (YYYYMMDDTHHMMSSZ) for timed events. UNTIL values with time but missing Z suffix are auto-corrected. Provide an empty list to remove recurrence so the event becomes non-recurring.
recurrence.title: Recurrence

send_updates.description: Defaults to True. Whether to send updates to the attendees. Please provide a value of type boolean.
send_updates.title: Send Updates

start_datetime.description: REQUIRED. Event start time in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS. IMPORTANT: Natural language expressions like 'tomorrow', 'next Monday', '2pm tomorrow' are NOT supported and will be rejected. You must provide the exact date and time in ISO format. Fractional seconds (e.g., .000) and timezone info (Z, +, -) will be automatically stripped if provided. Examples: '2025-01-16T13:00:00', '2025-01-16T13:00'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
start_datetime.title: Start Datetime

summary.description: Summary (title) of the event. Please provide a value of type string.
summary.title: Summary

timezone.description: IANA timezone name (e.g., 'America/New_York'). Required if datetime is naive. For recurring events, start and end must include a timeZone. If not provided, UTC is used. If datetime includes timezone info (Z or offset), this field is optional and defaults to UTC. Please provide a value of type string.
timezone.title: Timezone

transparency.description: 'opaque' (busy) or 'transparent' (available). Please provide a value of type string.
transparency.title: Transparency

visibility.description: Event visibility: 'default', 'public', 'private', or 'confidential'. Please provide a value of type string.
visibility.title: Visibility

workingLocationProperties.description:
Properties for workingLocation events. REQUIRES Google Workspace Enterprise.

Constraints discovered from testing:
- Must set transparency='transparent' and visibility='public'
- Description must be omitted
- Depending on 'type', include one of 'homeOffice', 'officeLocation', or 'customLocation'

value.description: Updates an existing event in Google Calendar. REQUIRES event_id - you MUST first search for the event using GOOGLECALENDAR_FIND_EVENT or GOOGLECALENDAR_EVENTS_LIST to obtain the event_id. This is a full PUT replacement, so provide all desired fields as unspecified ones may be cleared or reset.
value.display_description: Updates an existing event in Google Calendar. REQUIRES event_id - you MUST first search for the event using GOOGLECALENDAR_FIND_EVENT or GOOGLECALENDAR_EVENTS_LIST to obtain the event_id. This is a full PUT replacement, so provide all desired fields as unspecified ones may be cleared or reset.
value.name: googlecalendar_update_event

tasklist.description: The identifier of the task list from which to clear completed tasks. Use '@default' for the default task list. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
tasklist.title: Tasklist

value.description: Permanently clears all completed tasks from a specified Google Tasks list; this action is destructive and idempotent.
value.display_description: Permanently clears all completed tasks from a specified Google Tasks list; this action is destructive and idempotent.
value.name: googletasks_clear_tasks

tasklist_title.description: Title for the new task list. The maximum allowed length is 1024 characters. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.

value.description: Creates a new task list with the specified title.
value.display_description: Creates a new task list with the specified title.
value.name: googletasks_create_task_list

task_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Task to be deleted. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.

completed.description:
Date/time when the task was marked as completed. Only applicable when status='completed'. Unlike 'due', this field preserves the time component. 
Google Tasks API requires dates in RFC3339 format (e.g., 2025-09-22T13:48:27Z).
We automatically convert various human-readable formats to RFC3339:

Accepted formats:
• 2025-09-28T23:59:00Z → RFC3339/ISO-8601 format (preferred) - September 28, 2025 at 11:59 PM UTC
• 28 Sep 2025 → Simple date format - Will be converted to midnight UTC on that date
• 11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025 → Time with date - Assumes UTC timezone if not specified
• 1:00 PM, 21 Sep 2025 → 12-hour format with date - Converted to 13:00 UTC
• UTC-5:30, 6:50 PM → With timezone offset - Converted to UTC automatically
• UTC+1, 11:59 PM, 31 Dec → Timezone with date - Next occurrence of Dec 31
• 2025-09-21T15:30:00+02:00 → RFC3339 with timezone offset

Note: If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed. Dates without times default to midnight UTC. Please provide a value of type string.
completed.title: Completed

deleted.description: Whether the task has been deleted. Deleted tasks are marked but not immediately removed, allowing for recovery. Default: false. Please provide a value of type boolean.
deleted.title: Deleted

due.description:
Due date for the task (optional). NOTE: Google Tasks only stores the date portion - any time provided will be normalized to midnight UTC by the API. 
Google Tasks API requires dates in RFC3339 format (e.g., 2025-09-22T13:48:27Z).
We automatically convert various human-readable formats to RFC3339:

Accepted formats:
• 2025-09-28T23:59:00Z → RFC3339/ISO-8601 format (preferred) - September 28, 2025 at 11:59 PM UTC
• 28 Sep 2025 → Simple date format - Will be converted to midnight UTC on that date
• 11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025 → Time with date - Assumes UTC timezone if not specified
• 1:00 PM, 21 Sep 2025 → 12-hour format with date - Converted to 13:00 UTC
• UTC-5:30, 6:50 PM → With timezone offset - Converted to UTC automatically
• UTC+1, 11:59 PM, 31 Dec → Timezone with date - Next occurrence of Dec 31
• 2025-09-21T15:30:00+02:00 → RFC3339 with timezone offset

Note: If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed. Dates without times default to midnight UTC. Please provide a value of type string.
due.title: Due

etag.description: ETag of the resource for concurrency control. Prevents accidental overwrites when multiple clients modify the same task. Auto-generated by the API. Please provide a value of type string.
etag.title: Etag

hidden.description: Whether the task is hidden from the default view. Hidden tasks can still be accessed via API but won't show in UI. Default: false. Please provide a value of type boolean.
hidden.title: Hidden

id.description: Unique identifier for the task. Generated by Google Tasks API when creating a task. Used for updating or deleting existing tasks. Please provide a value of type string.
id.title: Id

notes.description: Additional details or description for the task. Supports plain text only (no HTML/markdown). Maximum 8192 characters. Example: 'Include Q3 sales data and projections'. Please provide a value of type string.
notes.title: Notes

status.description: Current status of the task (REQUIRED). Must be either 'needsAction' (task is pending) or 'completed' (task is done). Default: 'needsAction'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
status.title: Status

task_parent.description: Identifier of an existing task to serve as parent; if provided, creates a subtask, otherwise a top-level task in the specified list. Please provide a value of type string.
task_parent.title: Task Parent

task_previous.description: Identifier of an existing task after which the new task will be placed, at the same hierarchical level (as a sibling). Please provide a value of type string.
task_previous.title: Task Previous

tasklist_id.description: Identifier for the Google Task list where the new task will be created. Use actual task list IDs, not '@default'. You can get list IDs using 'List Task Lists' action. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
tasklist_id.title: Tasklist Id

title.description: Title/name of the task (REQUIRED). This is the main text displayed for the task. Maximum 1024 characters. Example: 'Complete quarterly report'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
title.title: Title

value.description: Creates a new task in a given `tasklist_id`, optionally as a subtask of an existing `task_parent` or positioned after an existing `task_previous` sibling, where both `task_parent` and `task_previous` must belong to the same `tasklist_id` if specified. IMPORTANT: Date fields (due, completed) accept various formats like '28 Sep 2025', '11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025', or ISO format '2025-09-21T15:30:00Z' and will automatically convert them to RFC3339 format required by the API.
